commentary_text: The referee of today's match will be Clement Turpin.
Germany will kick-off.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Flag goes up against Florian Wirtz (Germany) and the referee blows his whistle for offside.
Clement Turpin has a clear sight and sees a foul from John McGinn (Scotland).
Jamal Musiala (Germany) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
The ball is cleared after Andrew Robertson (Scotland) attempted to dribble past an opposing player.
Some patient build-up play from Germany as they look to unlock the defence.

Joshua Kimmich produces a killer pass to release Florian Wirtz (Germany), who then unleashes a low drive from the edge of the box and scores! The ball goes in off the left post, leaving the goalkeeper stranded. 1:0!
Total attempts – 1:0.
Robert Andrich (Germany) commits a rough foul. Clement Turpin stops the game and makes a call.
The Scotland players are exchanging short passes in an attempt to create a shooting opportunity.
Robert Andrich (Germany) threads a pass through the eye of a needle into the box for Florian Wirtz, but Angus Gunn displays great awareness to stop him.
It's 2:0! Kai Havertz feeds Jamal Musiala (Germany) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the top of the net.
Germany are seeing far more of the ball now.
Robert Andrich (Germany) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Clement Turpin blows his whistle for a foul.
Callum McGregor (Scotland) commits a foul after making a slide tackle on his opponent.
Ryan Christie (Scotland) jumps into a tackle and Clement Turpin signals a foul. Germany are awarded a penalty kick!
Celebrations by Germany are cut short as the referee signals that the penalty decision will be checked using the VAR. Hopefully it won't take too long.
The Germany players' joy was short-lived as the original decision is reversed after a VAR review by referee Clement Turpin. NO PENALTY!
A free kick on the edge of the box for Germany. Let's see if they'll manage to convert it into a goal.
Germany restart play with a quick free kick.
Kai Havertz (Germany) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Angus Gunn easily deals with the threat.
Poor challenge! Callum McGregor (Scotland) is penalised for tripping and Clement Turpin blows his whistle.
Robert Andrich (Germany) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Handball by Kai Havertz (Germany).
Clement Turpin blows his whistle after Ryan Christie (Scotland) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball.
Jonathan Tah (Germany) escapes without any punishment from the referee after using excessive force to foul his opponent.
Antonio Rudiger (Germany) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and fires in a shot that heads towards the middle of the goal, but Angus Gunn makes a comfortable save.
> peeled away from his marker and got on the end of a cross inside the box. He attempted to head the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the keeper made a block.
Ilkay Gundogan (Germany) breaks into the box and goes over after a challenge from an opposition player, but the ref signals NO penalty!
Toni Kroos (Germany) takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's not a big threat for the goalkeeper as his effort is blocked by a defender.
Wait! The referee makes the VAR signal and he's going to review that incident in the box from earlier. This could be a penalty for Germany! Let's see what he decides.
Ilkay Gundogan (Germany) is down injured and the referee stops play so that he can receive medical treatment.
The Germany players are happy as the referee awards a PENALTY after the VAR review!
Ryan Porteous (Scotland) makes a horrible challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
Ilkay Gundogan (Germany) seems to be alright and is okay to carry on.
Kai Havertz (Germany) is going to take the penalty!
The fourth official shows 3 min. of added time.
Goal! Kai Havertz (Germany) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Angus Gunn to commit before slotting the penalty into the middle of the goal.
Robert Andrich (Germany) makes a rough challenge and Clement Turpin blows his whistle for a foul.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Clement Turpin starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Julian Nagelsmann decided to make a change. Robert Andrich is replaced by Pascal Gross (Germany).
Steve Clarke has made a change at the break. Grant Hanley has come on in place of Che Adams (Scotland).
Scott McTominay (Scotland) strikes the ball towards goal, but it fails to reach the target after being well blocked by one of the defenders.
Anthony Ralston (Scotland) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Antonio Rudiger (Germany) has a sight of goal, fires a shot in from distance towards the left post and forces a good save out of Angus Gunn.
Toni Kroos (Germany) prepares to take a corner kick.
Ilkay Gundogan (Germany) tries to create a chance, but puts too much weight on his pass.
The up-to-date shots on target statistics – 7:0.
Ryan Christie (Scotland) is penalised for a foul. Clement Turpin had a clear view and blows his whistle.
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Germany) sends a pass into the box, but his attempt is thwarted and cleared.
Germany take a short corner instead of sending the ball into the penalty area.
Pascal Gross (Germany) unleashes a powerful shot towards goal, but it is bravely blocked by a self-sacrificing defender.
Joshua Kimmich (Germany) shoots from outside the box, but his effort is blocked.
Florian Wirtz (Germany) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly over the bar. The goalkeeper was lucky!
The defender bravely blocks the shot from Ilkay Gundogan (Germany) inside the box.
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Germany) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players.
Florian Wirtz (Germany) takes a mid-range shot, but it lacks accuracy and it goes way over the bar.
Jonathan Tah (Germany) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Here is a change. Kai Havertz is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Niclas Fullkrug (Germany).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Leroy Sane (Germany) for Florian Wirtz.
Leroy Sane (Germany) gets inside the box and tries to beat Angus Gunn with a measured shot into the bottom right corner, but the keeper is equal to the effort and makes a fine save.
Toni Kroos (Germany) launches the ball from the resulting corner, but one of the defenders is first to the ball and deals with the threat.
A rebound falls kindly for Maximilian Mittelstadt (Germany), but his shot from the edge of the box flies high over bar. None too pretty!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Billy Gilmour (Scotland) comes onto the pitch for Callum McGregor.
Steve Clarke has decided to make a change. Kenny McLean (Scotland) replaces John McGinn.
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Germany) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top right corner. He makes it 4:0.
Germany are showcasing great team work and neat passing moves.
Leroy Sane (Germany) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away.
Joshua Kimmich (Germany) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence clears the ball to safety.
Substitution. Jamal Musiala will be replaced by Thomas Muller (Germany).
A quickly taken corner by Germany.
The linesman raises his flag. Jonathan Tah (Germany) is adjudged offside.
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Germany) has the simplest of tasks to roll the ball into an empty net from close range after a rebound left the keeper stranded. 5:0.
Wait! Referee Clement Turpin has indicated he is going to review the Germany goal using VAR. It's probably to see if there was an offside in the build-up.
Here comes the VAR verdict. NO GOAL for Germany due to an offside in the build-up play.
Substitution. Kieran Tierney is replaced by Scott McKenna (Scotland).
Scott McTominay (Scotland) is penalised after knocking an opponent down.
One of the defenders is in the right place at the right time and makes a vital stop to deny a close-range header from Thomas Muller (Germany).
The resulting corner from Toni Kroos (Germany) is cleared.
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Germany) takes a snap shot from the edge of the box after a rebound, but his effort is a waste as it goes high over the bar.
Here's the change. Toni Kroos leaves the pitch and Emre Can (Germany) comes on as a substitute.
Steve Clarke has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Lawrence Shankland (Scotland) replacing Ryan Christie.
Leroy Sane (Germany) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge.
Leroy Sane (Germany) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the middle of the target, but Angus Gunn easily deals with the threat.
The current number of shots on goal is 10:0.
Clement Turpin blows his whistle after Emre Can (Germany) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle.
Leroy Sane (Germany) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but the effort is well over the bar.
Antonio Rudiger (Germany) is totally disorientated and accidentally puts the ball into his own goal!
The Scotland players celebrate the goal but the referee immediately signals a VAR review. Let's see what happens. Big moment in the game.
Referee Clement Turpin signals that the goal stands after the VAR review and the Scotland players have a reason to celebrate!
Niclas Fullkrug (Germany) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.
There will be a minimum of 3 min. of added time.
A cross from Pascal Gross (Germany) fails to reach the box as the defence clears the ball away to safety.
Brilliant finish! Emre Can (Germany) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Thomas Muller, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 5:1.
The match has just finished.
